data.title: Understanding the Apple Intelligence Report in iOS 18.1
data.meta_description: Learn how to read and understand the Apple Intelligence Report in iOS 18.1, enhancing transparency and security of smart features on your devices.
data.text:
With the release of iOS 18.1, Apple has introduced the Apple Intelligence Report, a feature aimed at providing transparency about the smart functionalities of the operating system. This report is designed to give users insight into how Apple’s AI processes their data, ensuring privacy and security.

What is the Apple Intelligence Report?

The Apple Intelligence Report documents the activities and responses generated by Apple Intelligence queries. It provides a detailed list of responses to user queries, including timestamps, identifiers, associated text, and the software components used to complete each task. This transparency helps users understand how their data is being used and processed.

Accessing the Report

To view the Apple Intelligence Report on your iPhone running iOS 18.1, follow these steps:

Open Settings: Go to the Settings app on your iPhone.

Select Privacy & Security: Navigate to the Privacy & Security section.

Choose Apple Intelligence Report: Tap on the Apple Intelligence Report option.

Verify with Face ID: Authenticate your identity using Face ID.

Select Report Duration: Choose the duration for which you want to generate the report (15 minutes or 7 days).

Export Activity: Tap Export Activity to save the report as a JSON file.

This JSON file can be saved to your iCloud Drive or iPhone storage, allowing you to open it with TextEdit on a Mac or preview it via the Files app.

Privacy and Security

Apple has emphasized that all data processing is secure and private. Queries sent to Apple’s servers are encrypted using Private Compute Modules, ensuring that even Apple cannot access the specific tasks performed. This commitment to privacy reassures users that their data is handled with the utmost care and security.

The Apple Intelligence Report in iOS 18.1 is a significant step towards greater transparency and user control over personal data. By providing detailed insights into how Apple Intelligence handles queries, Apple continues to prioritize privacy and security for its users. This feature not only enhances user trust but also sets a new standard for transparency in smart device functionalities.
